Villarejo de Salvanés is a municipality and town in the Community of Madrid, located in the so-called Las Vegas region and in the historic Alcarria de Chinchón.Located at kilometer 48 of the A-3 Madrid-Valencia highway.It has a population of 7,629 inhabitants (according to INE 2022). In the municipality there is an educational offer that covers from 0 years old to high school and vocational training.It has all kinds of shops and several supermarkets.It has a health center. Villarejo de Salvanés was declared a Historical Site in 1974, due to the historical relevance of its monumental heritage, composed of the CASA DE LA TERCIA, together with the CHURCH OF SAN ANDRÉS APÓSTOL and the TOWER OF TRIBUTE, which was part of the fortress of the Military Order from Santiago.Currently it is also recognized as one of the VILLAS OF MADRID. Villarejo has several bus lines arranged with the Transport Consortium of the Community of Madrid and connects it with other municipalities in the area, the Hospital del Sureste and Madrid capital.

Area: Villarejo de Salvanés is a charming municipality located in the Community of Madrid, which offers a large number of benefits to those who decide to live there. One of the main attractions of this place is its natural environment. Surrounded by beautiful landscapes, forests and green areas, Villarejo de Salvanés offers the opportunity to enjoy the tranquility and peace that life in contact with nature offers. In addition, this municipality has clean and pure air, which makes it an ideal place for those looking to escape the stress and pollution of the city. Breathing fresh air and enjoying open spaces becomes a revitalizing experience for the body and mind. In terms of services and amenities, Villarejo de Salvanés is not far behind. It has a wide educational offer, with quality schools and institutes, which guarantees an excellent education for children and young people. It also has health centers and medical services nearby, ensuring the well-being and necessary health care for its inhabitants. In terms of infrastructure, Villarejo de Salvanés is well connected to other nearby towns. It has good connections by road and public transport, which makes it easier to travel to Madrid or other nearby areas. In addition, it has a wide variety of local stores where you can find everything you need for everyday life. The quality of life in Villarejo de Salvanés is really high. The calm and welcoming atmosphere creates an environment conducive to enjoying community life. Residents get to know each other and a sense of belonging and camaraderie is created. In addition, it is a safe municipality, which provides peace of mind to its inhabitants. Finally, Villarejo de Salvanés offers a wide range of cultural and sports activities for all tastes. From festivals and cultural events to quality sports facilities, there is always something interesting to do here. In addition, its privileged location near natural spaces such as the Southeast Regional Park provides the opportunity to enjoy outdoor activities such as hiking, cycling or walks in nature. In summary, living in Villarejo de Salvanés is an excellent choice for those looking for quality of life, tranquility and contact with nature. With its privileged natural environment, services and amenities, as well as its welcoming and safe environment, this municipality offers everything you need to enjoy a full and satisfying life. Villarejo de Salvanés is a municipality and town in the Community of Madrid (Spain), located in the so-called Las Vegas region and in the historic Alcarria de Chinchón. It belongs to the diocese of Alcalá de Henares (Madrid) and the judicial district of Arganda del Rey. Its patron saint is the Holy Virgin of Victory of Lepanto and Saint Andrew the Apostle is its patron saint. It has a vast municipal area with an area of 118.6 km² in which it integrates four other sections: Las Huertas de Villarejo, Buena Mesón, La Varga and Vega Corbera. Located at kilometer 48 of the A-3 Madrid-Valencia highway, it borders the following towns: to the north with Tielmes 12 km away and Perales de Tajuña 11 km away; to the east with Valdaracete 9 km and Fuentidueña de Tajo 12 km; to the south with Villamanrique de Tajo at 11 km and Villarrubia de Santiago (Toledo) at 38 km; and to the west with Valdelaguna 8 km away, Colmenar de Oreja 12 km away and Belmonte de Tajo 6 km away. It is located between two rivers, the Tajo and the Tajuña and is located at an altitude of 756 m.

It is a municipality and town in the Community of Madrid, located in the so-called Las Vegas region and in the historic Alcarria de Chinchón. It belongs to the diocese of Alcalá de Henares and the judicial district of Arganda del Rey. Located at kilometer 48 of the A-3 Madrid-Valencia highway, it borders the following towns: to the north with Tielmes 12 km away and Perales de Tajuña 11 km away; to the east with Valdaracete 9 km and Fuentidueña de Tajo 12 km; to the south with Villamanrique de Tajo at 11 km and Villarrubia de Santiago (Toledo) at 38 km; and to the west with Valdelaguna 8 km away, Colmenar de Oreja 12 km away and Belmonte de Tajo 6 km away. It is located between two rivers, the Tajo and the Tajuña and is located at an altitude of 756 m.
